object.property:
--contrast-weight=WEIGHT
weight given to pixels in high-contrast neighborhoods

--contrast-weight=WEIGHT
weight given to pixels in high-contrast neighborhoods

--exposure-mu=MEAN
center also known as MEAN of Gaussian weighting

--exposure-mu=MEAN
center also known as MEAN of Gaussian weighting
Auto crop the image to the area covered by all images.
Optimize image center shift for all images, except for first. Useful for aligning more distorted images.
Optimize field of view for all images, except for first. Useful for aligning focus stacks with slightly different magnification.
Optimize radial distortion for all images, except for first.

--corr
Correlation threshold for identifying control points (default: 0.9).

-c
Number of control points to create between adjacent images (default: 8).

-t
Remove all control points with an error higher than num pixels (default: 3).

-x
Optimize X coordinate of the camera position.

-y
Optimize Y coordinate of the camera position.

-z
Optimize Z coordinate of the camera position.

--gray-projector=OPERATOR
apply gray-scale projection OPERATOR in exposure or contrast weighing, where OPERATOR is one of "average", "l-star", "lightness", "value", "luminance", or "channel-mixer:RED-WEIGHT:GREEN-WEIGHT:BLUE-WEIGHT".

--levels=LEVELS
number of blending LEVELS to use

--levels=LEVELS
number of blending LEVELS to use

--hard-mask
force hard blend masks and no averaging on finest scale; this is especially useful for focus stacks with thin and high contrast features, but leads to increased noise.

--contrast-window-size=SIZE
set window SIZE for local-contrast analysis

--contrast-window-size=SIZE
set window SIZE for local-contrast analysis.

--contrast-min-curvature=CURVATURE
minimum CURVATURE for an edge to qualify

--contrast-min-curvature=CURVATURE
minimum CURVATURE for an edge to qualify.

--contrast-edge-scale=EDGESCALE[:LCESCALE[:LCEFACTOR]]
set scale on which to look for edges; positive LCESCALE switches on local contrast enhancement by LCEFACTOR (EDGESCALE, LCESCALE, LCEFACTOR >= 0); append "%" to LCESCALE for values relative to EDGESCALE; append "%" to LCEFACTOR for relative value.
A non-zero value for EDGE-SCALE switches on the Laplacian-of- Gaussian (LoG) edge detection algorithm. EDGE-SCALE is the radius of the Gaussian used in the search for edges.

A positive LCE-SCALE turns on local contrast enhancement (LCE) before the LoG edge detection. LCE-SCALE is the radius of the Gaussian used in the enhancement step, LCE-FACTOR is the weight factor (“strength”).
The larger resolution - the longer it takes to generate preview.
The larger resolution - the longer it takes to generate preview.
Enter name of graphics editor to edit images (f.e. gimp (default), fotoxx, delaboratory)
